name: HTML
text: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the code that is used to structure a web page and its content. For example, content could be structured within a set of paragraphs, a list of bulleted points, or using images and data tables

name: CSS
text: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. CSS describes how HTML elements are to be displayed on screen, paper, or  in other media CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web pages all at once External stylesheets are stored in CSS files

name: JavaScript
text: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language. JavaScript is the programming language of the Web. JavaScript is easy to learn

name: React
text: React is a JavaScript-based UI development library. Facebook and an open-source developer community run it. Although React is a library rather than a language, it is widely used in web development. The library first appeared in May 2013 and is now one of the most commonly used frontend libraries for web development.

name: Node.js
text: MongoDB is the most powerful database system to work with node.js and express(node framework) makes the node application to organize and keep adapting with MVC architecture.

name: Next.js
text: Next.js is a React framework that gives you building blocks to create web applications. By framework, we mean Next.js handles the tooling and configuration needed for React, and provides additional structure, features, and optimizations for your application.
